summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from Warden J. Petrucci of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York to the Assistant Director of Reentry Services, responding to a psychological reconstruction report on inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details institutional responses to recommendations regarding suicide watch procedures, cellmate assignments, and documentation accuracy following Epstein's July 23, 2019, suicide attempt/gesture. This document is part of an internal review or reconstruction report concerning the detention and death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details numerous procedural failures and irregularities in Epstein's custody, including issues with suicide watch protocols, telephone call monitoring, inmate accountability, and documentation. The text includes findings and institutional responses to specific deficiencies. This document is part of a psychological reconstruction report and internal email chain regarding the management and suicide watch protocols for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details staff training deficiencies, operational procedures for suicide watch, and email updates on Epstein's psychological status and complaints in July 2019, shortly before his death.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with abrasions on his neck and knee. Inconsistencies exist in staff descriptions of the scene (e.g., a string vs. orange cloth around his neck).

events.title: Epstein Placed in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Email About Log Book Errors
events.description: Associate Warden [redacted] sent an email to Dr. [redacted] (cc Warden N'Diaye) conveying information about errors in Epstein's suicide watch log book.

events.title: Epstein's Arrival at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at MCC New York. An email sent that evening described him as 'distraught, sad and a little confused,' but required suicide prevention protocols were not followed.

events.title: Epstein Denied Bail
events.description: A judge denied bail for Jeffrey Epstein, which the report notes was a significant disappointment that likely challenged his ability to adapt to incarceration. The report criticizes the lack of a psychological assessment following this event.

events.title: Extended Attorney Visits During Psychological Observation
events.description: While on Psychological Observation, Epstein attended attorney visits for exceptionally long hours (e.g., 11.25 hours on July 24) without the required 'direct, continuous observation' by BOP staff.

events.title: Monitored Telephone Call
events.description: Unit Manager Proto provided Jeffrey Epstein with a monitored telephone call to a friend at 5:15 p.m., documented in a Correctional Systems Department log.

events.title: Epstein Returns from Court with USMS Alert
events.description: Epstein returned from court. The USMS provided a Prisoner Custody Alert Notice stating he had 'MTL Mental Concerns Suicidal Tendencies.' Required suicide monitoring procedures were not followed upon his return.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Dr. Imeri conducted a suicide risk assessment on Jeffrey Epstein at approximately 1:30 p.m., after becoming aware of the USMS alert from the previous day.

events.title: Unmonitored Telephone Call
events.description: Epstein terminated a legal visit early to place a telephone call. Escorted by Mr. Bullock, he was given a phone in the SHU shower area. He claimed to be calling his deceased mother. The call was placed by staff dialing a 347 area code number.

events.title: 3rd Quarter SHU Training
events.description: Quarterly Suicide Prevention training was conducted for SHU staff at MCC New York. Three officers did not attend.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psych Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was taken off Psychological Observation status and was pending placement in the SHU. He complained of arm numbness, neck numbness, and a malfunctioning toilet.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psych Observation to SHU
events.description: An earlier email indicates inmate Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the SHU, with no suicide watch.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on July 23, 2019, with injuries to his neck and knee, in an incident described with inconsistencies by staff.
MCC Executive Staff initially housed Epstein with inmate Mr. Tartaglione, a high-profile ex-police officer, considering him less likely to harm Epstein.
A psychological reconstruction recommended Epstein be housed with another sex offender, but this was not implemented; he was later considered for housing with cooperator Efrain Reyes.
Significant documentation errors were noted, including a Drug Treatment Specialist improperly copying and initialing suicide watch log entries made by an officer in the wrong log book.
The institution eliminated the use of 'Psychological Observation' status to avoid confusion and implemented new procedures for suicide watch monitoring and documentation.
Procedural failures in suicide watch protocols were identified, including a lack of 'direct, continuous observation' during Epstein's extended attorney visits while on Psychological Observation.
There were significant inaccuracies in the SENTRY system regarding inmate cell assignments, with three inmates (including Epstein) incorrectly listed in a double-occupancy SHU cell.
Epstein was allowed to make an unmonitored telephone call on August 9, 2019, where he claimed to be calling his mother, who had been deceased since 2004.
A USMS Prisoner Custody Alert Notice on July 31, 2019, flagged Epstein with 'MTL Mental Concerns Suicidal Tendencies,' but required follow-up monitoring procedures were not implemented.
Critical documentation, including Attorney Log Books, was not properly secured after Epstein's death and was found to contain systemic errors and lack of control.
Three MCC New York officers (Dubenezic, Monge, Grijalva) failed to attend mandatory quarterly Suicide Prevention training for the SHU in June 2019, indicating potential compliance issues.
Detailed suicide watch protocols are outlined, including the use of separate log books for staff and inmate companions, constant visual observation, and strict cell restrictions.
In July 2019, Jeffrey Epstein complained of medical issues (numbness in arm and neck) and a disruptive, malfunctioning toilet in his cell that ran for 45 minutes.
The institution identified a need for better staff understanding of sex-offender specific risk factors for managing high-profile cases like Epstein's.
The Drug Abuse Program Coordinator position was abolished in 2018 but efforts were underway to re-establish it as a full-time role to provide additional clinical supervision.
